title: The new CBSE Class 10 board exam system and how it will work from 2026 - Explained
content: Starting in 2026, CBSE will implement a biannual Class 10 board exam system, offering students two chances each academic year—one mandatory and one optional for improvement. As per NEP-2020, the move aims to reduce exam stress and increase flexibility. Students may improve up to three subjects, and only the best score will be retained. The policy includes specific rules for special categories, result handling, and provisional Class XI admission based on first exam results.

title: ‘Just praise him a little’: Trump repeats mediation claim; Congress taunts PM Modi again
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized Prime Minister Modi following Donald Trump's renewed claim of halting a war between India and Pakistan using trade leverage. Congress leader Pawan Khera accused Modi of potentially compromising India's interests for praise. Trump asserted he intervened through phone calls, linking trade deals to de-escalation.

title: After English, a lesson in French: Shashi Tharoor slams Pakistan in Russia -watch
content: Shashi Tharoor garnered acclaim for his fluent French while challenging Pakistan's inclusion in a Russian-led anti-terrorism conference. During a meeting with Leonid Slutsky in Moscow, Tharoor highlighted Pakistan's role as a safe haven for terrorist groups, emphasizing their training, funding, and arming of terrorists. His remarks, delivered in French, quickly went viral, praised for both linguistic skill and diplomatic clarity.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir refuses to laud Pant's twin tons after loss – 'There were ...'
content: Following India's shocking Test defeat against England, head coach Gautam Gambhir downplayed individual achievements, despite centuries from Rishabh Pant and others. He emphasised the team's failure to defend a massive score, highlighting England's record chase led by Ben Duckett. Fast bowler Harshit Rana has been released from the squad as injury concerns eased.

title: America’s China threat: Huawei’s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions; What experts are saying
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: 'I made some wrong friends, lost focus on cricket': Prithvi Shaw
content: Prithvi Shaw, once hailed as a future star, candidly admits to making poor choices and losing focus on cricket, leading to a decline in his career. After being dropped due to fitness issues and going unsold in the IPL, Shaw seeks a fresh start by leaving the Mumbai Cricket Association to play for Maharashtra.

title: Massive! Sachin Tendulkar reveals life-changing moment: 'I was just 10 when ...'
content: On June 25, 1983, Kapil Dev's India achieved an improbable victory against the West Indies, securing their first ICC World Cup. This historic win at Lord's dramatically altered India's cricketing trajectory, inspiring a generation, including a young Sachin Tendulkar. The veteran shared a touching account of the same on his X handle.

title: Accenture sees highest-ever quarterly drop in headcount, as numbers fall by ...
content: Accenture's Q3 FY25 saw an 8% revenue increase, reaching $7.7 billion, fueled by AI service demand. Despite a gross margin dip and workforce reduction, the company raised its revenue growth forecast. Generative AI bookings surged, contributing significantly to overall revenue, with the Americas leading regional performance. The company projects strong Q4 revenues, emphasizing its role as a reinvention partner.

title: Trump’s Iran gambit: Why Xi Jinping stayed quiet - what it means for Taiwan
content: June 2025 marked a pivotal moment when US President Trump launched airstrikes targeting Iranian nuclear sites, prompting a surprisingly muted reaction from China that intrigued international observers. Although China publicly denounced the strikes as illegal under international law, it chose not to escalate tensions through significant diplomatic means or military posturing.

title: IND vs ENG: India fast bowler released from squad ahead of 2nd Test in Birmingham
content: India's Harshit Rana has been released from the Test squad before the second match against England. This decision follows after India's loss at Headingley, despite their impressive 835 runs and five centuries. England's remarkable chase of 371, led by Ben Duckett's 149, secured a five-wicket victory. India aims to level the series in the upcoming Edgbaston Test on July 2.

title: Killed by TTP: Pakistan major who captured Abhinandan dies; Munir attends funeral
content: A Pakistan military officer, Major Syed Moiz Abbas Shah, who claimed to have captured Indian Air Force pilot Abhinandan Varthaman in 2019, has been killed in a clash with Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants near the Afghan border. The Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) reported that Major Shah died alongside Lance Naik Jibran Ullah during an operation in South Waziristan.

title: Amazon employees to CEO: 'Nothing more motivating on a Tuesday than...'
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: Punjab: After Meerut drum murder case, man's body found in a blue drum in Ludhiana
content: A dead body was discovered in a blue drum in Ludhiana's Sherpur area. The victim's limbs were tied. Rag pickers found the drum and alerted the police due to a foul smell. Police investigation revealed the body was wrapped in a bedsheet inside a gunny bag. The victim is estimated to be around 40 years old.

title: ‘Some of his shots probably weren’t ...’: Chappell sends Pant honest feedback
content: Greg Chappell lauded Rishabh Pant's explosive batting in the recent Test match against England, comparing his game-changing impact to that of former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist. Pant's twin centuries at Headingley, a feat matched only by Andy Flower previously, showcased his fearless approach and ability to keep bowlers on their toes.

title: 'Badly damaged’: In a first, Iran admits impact on nuclear sites in US strikes
content: Iran has acknowledged that recent US strikes caused significant damage to its nuclear installations. This admission follows President Trump's claims that the strikes "obliterated" Iran's nuclear program. Trump asserted that Iran's nuclear ambitions have been significantly delayed, drawing a controversial parallel to the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union opens up about financial pressures
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, discussed her financial strategies at a recent event. She highlighted the need for multiple income streams. Union emphasized managing expenses, including supporting her extended family. She also mentioned dividing expenses with her husband, Dwyane Wade. The couple recently navigated Wade's health challenges. They continue to share updates about their lives with their fans.

title: Income Tax Return: What is Form 16? Check this before filing ITR
content: ITR filing: Form 16, a crucial document for salaried taxpayers, is issued by employers, detailing TDS on salary. It contains vital information like employer/employee details, income earned, and deductions.

title: NBA Trade Rumors: LA Lakers reportedly eyeing $13,372,418 Utah Jazz star to join LeBron James and Luka Doncic to add power to the squad
content: The Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly showing significant interest in acquiring Utah Jazz center Walker Kessler and are willing to offer multiple draft picks. Despite Utah's rebuild and Kessler's potential trade value, they haven't shown a strong inclination to trade him. Several teams are interested in Kessler due to his defensive prowess and offensive growth.

title: Moscow airport: Man flips, slams Iranian toddler on floor; child in coma
content: In a horrifying incident at a Moscow airport, a man from Belarus violently attacked an 18-month-old boy, causing severe injuries. The child, who had recently arrived from Iran with his pregnant mother, is now in a coma. Authorities detained the suspect, Vladimir Vitkov, and found evidence of drug use, investigating the motive behind the brutal assault.

title: Socialist PIO Mamdani on track to become NYC Mayor, shocking US establishment
content: Zohran Mamdani, an Indian-American, is likely to become New York City's next mayor. He defeated Andrew Cuomo in the primary. Mamdani, a Democratic Socialist, may become the city's first Muslim and Indian-American mayor. His campaign focused on populist ideas. He received support from Bernie Sanders and Alexandra Ocasio-Cortez.

title: Where to watch the 2025 NBA draft- Date, time, streaming details and more
content: Basketball enthusiasts eagerly anticipate the 2025 NBA Draft, a two-day event commencing on June 25th at 8 p.m. ET. The draft, broadcast on ESPN and ABC from Barclays Center, will unveil the next generation of stars, including Duke's Cooper Flagg. The draft lottery, overseen by Ernst & Young, determines the coveted No.

title: Teacher suspended for reporting to duty intoxicated in MP - watch
content: Kavita Kawche, a government school teacher in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, has been suspended after a video surfaced showing her arriving at school intoxicated. She was seen slurring, threatening staff, and misbehaving with laborers involved in school repairs. The incident, which occurred on June 23, prompted an inquiry revealing past instances of similar behavior.

title: 'Whether Bumrah is fit or not ...' - Gavaskar makes massive call ahead of 2nd Test
content: Following India's defeat to England, Sunil Gavaskar suggested that spinner Kuldeep Yadav should replace Shardul Thakur for the Birmingham Test, anticipating favorable conditions for wrist spin. Gavaskar also expressed concerns about the middle order, particularly Sai Sudharsan and Karun Nair after their dismissals.

title: Watch: Baby elephant stops for a quick snack on road
content: A heartwarming video capturing a baby elephant's innocent interaction with a roadside fruit cart has gone viral. The tiny calf, during a walk with its herd, gently grabbed a fruit, showcasing a beautiful moment of coexistence between humans and wildlife. This tender interaction has charmed social media users, sparking conversations about coexistence and kindness.

title: Stealth leak: India‑born B‑2 engineer sold secrets to China - Espionage revisited
content: Noshir Sheriarji Gowadia, an Indian-American engineer, aided in the creation of America's B-2 stealth bomber. He later betrayed the US by selling classified information to China. This information helped China develop undetectable exhaust systems. Gowadia was arrested and convicted of espionage. He is currently serving a 32-year sentence. His actions now resurface amid geopolitical tensions.

title: 'Don't ask permission': Tharoor's cryptic post after Kharge's 'Modi first' jibe
content: Following Mallikarjun Kharge's indirect criticism of Shashi Tharoor for praising Narendra Modi, Tharoor posted a cryptic message about independence. Kharge questioned Tharoor's priorities, emphasizing "nation first." Tharoor defended his article, clarifying it wasn't a sign of joining the BJP but a statement of national unity.

title: 'Too hard on brain': Flight phobia grips travellers after Ahmedabad Air India crash
content: Following the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, a wave of panic has surged among flyers in India, leading to increased anxiety and fear. This incident has caused a spike in therapy requests, flight cancellations, and a preference for specific aircraft types. The crash footage has triggered insomnia, panic attacks, and obsessive flight tracking, impacting the travel industry with booking declines and cancellations.

title: IND vs ENG: Former selector slams India - 'Those were simple catches, no one drops those'
content: India faced a defeat against England in the first Test at Headingley. Kiran More emphasized the importance of fielding. He noted dropped catches proved costly. England chased down 371 runs. Shubman Gill, Rishabh Pant, and Yashasvi Jaiswal scored centuries in the first innings. More believes the team is in transition. He asks for time and support for the new players.

title: Bikram Majithia arrested: SIT uncovers Rs 540 crore drug money trail
content: Punjab Vigilance Bureau alleges Bikram Singh Majithia laundered drug money. The Bureau claims illicit funds were laundered through various channels. Unaccounted cash deposits, foreign entities, and unexplained deposits are under scrutiny. The SIT found evidence of property acquisitions without legitimate income sources. A search was conducted at Majithia's Amritsar residence.

title: 500% tariff on Russia? Will Trump tighten economic screws on Kremlin
content: Donald Trump's administration might not increase sanctions on Russia. Secretary of State Marco Rubio wants room for peace talks. He fears more sanctions could halt negotiations with Russia regarding Ukraine. The US hasn't lifted existing sanctions. The White House is working on tariffs for countries importing Russian energy. Russia aims to gain territory through military action. The US believes this will be difficult for Russia to achieve.

title: Kareena cheers up Karisma on birthday, Vedang-Khushi spotted post 'date': Top 5 celeb news today
content: Ram Kapoor addressed his inappropriate comments. Kareena Kapoor supported Karisma Kapoor on her birthday after Sunjay Kapur's death. Kajol felt isolated during 'Ishq' shoot with Aamir Khan and Juhi Chawla. Govinda previewed his comeback film 'Duniyadari'. Khushi Kapoor and Vedang Raina were seen on a late-night movie date. These events have captured attention.

title: Next-gen highway: Dwarka Expressway gets India’s first AI traffic system
content: India has launched its first Advanced Traffic Management System (ATMS) project on the Dwarka Expressway in Delhi, aligning with NHAI's 2023 guidelines. This AI-powered system, covering 56.46 km, integrates traffic monitoring cameras, incident detection, and enforcement systems. It aims to enhance road safety by detecting traffic violations and disseminating information, setting a national benchmark for intelligent traffic management.

title: Magnus Carlsen lost to 9-year-old Indian? All you need to know
content: Nine-year-old Aarit Kapil drew against world champion Magnus Carlsen in an online chess tournament, showcasing his impressive skills. While Aarit competed in Georgia, V Pranav secured first place in the 'Early Titled Tuesday' event. Carlsen also achieved a historic 2900 rating in freestyle chess, surpassing his previous classical peak and demonstrating his dominance in the chess world.

title: New nuclear threat: Pakistan developing ballistic missile that could hit US
content: US intelligence indicates Pakistan is developing an ICBM, potentially capable of reaching the United States. This pursuit challenges the existing strategic landscape, possibly aiming to deter US intervention. The acquisition could redefine US-Pakistan relations, as historically, nations with such capabilities haven't been considered allies, raising concerns about nuclear escalation.

title: 'Like Hiroshima': Trump says US strike on Iran ended war
content: President Trump asserted that US strikes have significantly crippled Iran's nuclear capabilities, setting them back decades and preventing bomb construction. He likened the strikes' impact to the end of World War II, while also claiming a ceasefire brokered between Iran and Israel is progressing well. Trump dismissed reports suggesting the strikes were ineffective, labeling them as "fake news."

title: Ax-4 launch: Yuvraj reacts to Shukla's milestone - 'This is a moment we’ll ...'
content: India celebrates the successful launch of the Axiom-4 mission, marking its return to human spaceflight after 41 years. Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, aboard the SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, carries the aspirations of 1.4 billion Indians to the International Space Station. Prime Minister Modi and former cricketer Yuvraj Singh expressed national pride.

title: CBSE approves biannual Class 10 board exams
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will conduct Class 10 board exams twice a year starting in 2026. The first phase will be mandatory, while the second phase will be optional, allowing students to improve their scores with the best result being retained. Internal assessments will be held once annually. This policy aims to reduce exam stress, offer flexibility, and enhance learning outcomes, marking a major reform in India’s education system.

title: Ax-4 launch successful: Shukla is 1st Indian in space in 40yrs; will be first ever at ISS
content: The Axiom-4 mission, carrying Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla and three international crewmates, successfully launched to the International Space Station after delays. Shukla, as pilot, marks a significant step for India in space exploration. The crew will conduct over 60 science experiments during their two-week stay, contributing to research in various fields before returning to Earth.

title: Axiom Mission 4: Shukla’s playlist had this SRK song; a 'Swades' moment
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the pilot of the Axiom Mission 4, shared his favourite song ahead of the launch from NASA's Kennedy Space Centre in Florida. Unveiling his launch day playlist, the Indian pilot revealed that he loves to listen to Shah Rukh Khan's 'Swades' movie song 'Yuh Hi Chala Chal'.

title: ‘Hopefully will purchase…’: Trump says China can get Iran oil, but wants it to buy from US
content: Following an Israel-Iran ceasefire, President Trump suggested China could continue purchasing Iranian oil, though the White House clarified this wasn't an easing of US sanctions. Despite Trump's call for China to buy more US oil, analysts doubt this will significantly alter China's import patterns, given existing trade dynamics and Beijing's energy security priorities.

title: Two-round NBA mock draft: We made 22 pick updates based on intel, trades
content: Round 1 of the NBA draft is tonight (8 ET on ABC and ESPN), and we have the intel on trade talks and picks.

title: The 'abrupt reversal of fortune' that changed everything for Cooper Flagg and the Mavs
content: The presumptive No. 1 pick and the Mavs, still reeling from trading Luka Doncic, might be made for each other.

title: Sources: VanVleet to sign new deal with Rockets
content: Rockets guard Fred VanVleet intends to sign a two-year, $50 million contract to stay with the franchise, with a player option in 2026-27, sources told ESPN.

title: Fever waive Bonner, who says fit 'did not work'
content: The Indiana Fever have waived guard/forward DeWanna Bonner, one of their key free agent acquisitions in the offseason, after she had missed five games due to what was termed personal reasons.

title: Oilers trade Evander Kane to hometown Canucks
content: Evander Kane, who returned for the Oilers in the playoffs after missing the entire regular season after multiple surgeries, was traded to his hometown Canucks on Wednesday, clearing cap space before free agency.

title: ChiSox ban fan for taunt about Marte's late mom
content: A 22-year-old fan has been banned indefinitely from Rate Field after yelling something about Diamondbacks second baseman Ketel Marte's late mother during Tuesday night's game against the White Sox, the team told ESPN on Wednesday morning.

title: Sportsbooks have Flagg in rare air for NBA draft
content: Cooper Flagg's odds to be the top pick in the draft had reached -100,000 at multiple sportsbooks Thursday morning, meaning a bettor would need to risk $1,000 to win $1 on the Duke product going first overall to the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Pirates remove Cruz after he loses track of outs
content: Pittsburgh Pirates veteran outfielder Oneil Cruz, 26, said he lost track of the outs in the seventh inning, when he didn't run out a double-play grounder, a move that led to his removal in his club's 9-3 loss to the Milwaukee Brewers on Tuesday night.

title: Bregman open to new Red Sox deal, agent says
content: Alex Bregman, who can opt out and become a free agent after his first season with the Red Sox, is open "to any conversation" about a new deal, his agent said.

title: Sources: Kyrie to sign new 3-year deal with Mavs
content: Mavericks All-Star guard Kyrie Irving is declining his $43 million player option and intends to sign a three-year, $119 million contract with the franchise, sources told ESPN.

title: 30-game winner Paul Skenes?! A new formula to bring pitcher wins back to life
content: MLB's best pitcher has a 1.85 ERA but just a 4-6 record. In the age of analytics, he's not alone. Here's how to fix it.

title: 'Championships, fan experience, community': After 20 years as Vikings owners, Wilfs have one last goal
content: The Wilf family built a revered stadium and gets rave reviews from players, but the Vikings have yet to win a Super Bowl.

title: Why Aaron Rodgers' one-and-done plan is great news for the Steelers
content: The Steelers can start planning for the future of the QB position because they don't have to guess about Rodgers' intentions.

title: 'Everything's on the table' for Connor McDavid's NHL future
content: The NHL's best player has one year left on his contract. Will he re-sign, or will he test free agency in 2026?

title: Who makes the Hall of Fame in 2026? Ranking the top candidates
content: Does Patrice Bergeron make it in his first year eligible? What about Keith Tkachuk? Predicting the next class.

title: Bilas: Eight prospects who stand out in this year's NBA draft class
content: From the no-brainer to the wild cards to those in between, here are eight prospects who caught Jay Bilas' eye.

title: Our one-stop shop for the draft: Mocks, order, big questions and more
content: From teams to watch to our latest mock draft, we have everything you need to know about the 2025 draft.

title: Inside Bryce Steele's journey back to football after battling cancer
content: After battling cancer in 2023, Boston College linebacker Bryce Steele is set to be a starter this fall.

title: 10 undervalued pass-catchers with intriguing upside or safer floors
content: Matt Bowen lists his favorites with week-winning potential and others who are dependable, despite lower ADPs.

title: From Man City to Flamengo, why every last-16 team will, won't win Club World Cup
content: We're heading into the knockout rounds of the 2025 Club World Cup as the field of 32 splits in half this week. With updated odds and projections, here's why every remaining team will or won't win this thing.

title: Luka Modric agrees to join AC Milan after CWC
content: Luka Modric has verbally agreed to sign for AC Milan, where he will sign a one-year contract, with an option to extend for another year.

title: Barça to return to Spotify Camp Nou on Aug. 10
content: Barça are still expected to begin next season's LaLiga with three away games despite marking their return to the Spotify Camp Nou for the Joan Gamper Trophy.

title: Sources: Atlético reach deal for USMNT's Cardoso
content: Atlético Madrid have reached a verbal agreement with Betis to sign USMNT midfielder Johnny Cardoso, sources have told ESPN.

title: Happy birthday! Newell's name stand after Messi
content: Newell's Old Boys' new stand at their Coloso Marcelo Bielsa stadium has been named after Lionel Messi, announcing the decision on the day the Inter Miami forward turned 38 years old.

title: Sources: Fati to join Monaco on loan from Barça
content: Barcelona's Ansu Fati is set to join AS Monaco on loan next season after both clubs reached a full agreement on Wednesday, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Chelsea near deal for Dortmund's Gittens
content: Chelsea are edging closer to a deal with Borussia Dortmund for winger Jamie Gittens after representatives from the two teams held discussions in the United States during the Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: French giants Lyon relegated over financial issues
content: Seven-time French champions Lyon, owned by American businessman John Textor, have been relegated to the second tier of French football due to the club's financial problems.

title: Rodri's return for Man City is just what Pep Guardiola & Co. needed
content: Ask anyone who Man City's most important player is, and you'd hear one name repeatedly: Rodri. After a nine-month injury absence that contributed to their worst season under Pep Guardiola, he's getting back to full fitness. Look out.

title: Five underappreciated starting pitchers you need to grab now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft looks at the surprising lack of love for some of the starting pitchers with very strong underlying metrics.

title: Will Jake Paul's hook land better than Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.'s?
content: The question is not if Paul can beat a real fighter, but if Chavez, a former champion, can go toe-to-toe with Paul.

title: Power Rankings: Mercury overtake Liberty with five-game winning streak
content: Phoenix has bucked speculation over its new-look roster with 11 wins, including over the defending champions.

title: Pound for pound: With Jon Jones walking away, where does the top 10 stand?
content: The consensus GOAT has retired, leaving the sport's remaining greats to line up differently in ESPN's rankings.

title: Billionaires, Boats, Backlash: How Jeff Bezos' Venice Wedding Is Causing Uproar
content: Residents accuse Bezos of treating Venice like a billionaire's playground, ignoring the city's ongoing struggles with mass tourism, rising housing costs, and climate change.

title: 2 Dead, 20 Feared Swept Away As Cloudbursts, Flash Floods Batter Himachal
content: Two persons died while about 20 were feared swept away as cloudburst, flash floods and heavy rain wreaked havoc in Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday.

title: US-Iran Talks Next Week, Nuclear Agreement May Be On Table: Donald Trump
content: US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the United States and Iran "may sign an agreement" regarding Tehran's nuclear programme when the two sides meet for talks next week.

title: Mexico President Threatens To Sue Over Falling Debris From SpaceX Launches In US
content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum on Wednesday threatened legal action over falling debris and contamination from SpaceX rocket launches across the border in the United States.

title: "Stood Firmly": Iran Thanks Indians For Support During Conflict With Israel
content: The Iranian Embassy in New Delhi on Wednesday expressed heartfelt gratitude to the people and institutions of India for their solidarity and support during the recent conflict with Israel.

title: Ready To Talk But Not With Congress: Devendra Fadnavis On Highway Project
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis declared today that while he was ready to discuss the Shaktipeeth Highway project with people opposing it, he would not entertain political opponents.

title: "He'll Handle It": Shubhanshu Shukla's Mother On Son Reaching For The Stars
content: It was tears of joy, the mother of the second India to fly into space told NDTV today, hours after the launch of the Axiom Mission 4 mission from NASA's Kennedy Space Centre in Florida.

title: Hydroponic Cannabis Worth Rs 3.47 Crore Seized At Mumbai Airport, 2 Arrested
content: Customs officials on Wednesday arrested two persons after recovering hydroponic marijuana valued at Rs 3.47 crore from them at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport here, an official said.

title: Military Spending Soars Globally Amid Rise In Armed Conflicts
content: New war fronts have emerged across the globe, driving a rapid surge in military spending. In 2024, global military expenditure reached $2.718 trillion, up 9.4 per cent from 2023, marking the largest annual increase since 1988.

title: Rs 540 Crore Of 'Drug Money' Laundered By Akali Leader, Says Probe Agency
content: The Punjab Vigilance Bureau on Wednesday arrested senior Akali leader Bikram Singh Majithia for allegedly laundering more than Rs 540 crore of "drug money".

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Axiom-4 Launch LIVE: "Tiranga Tells Me...," Says Shubhanshu Shukla As He Heads To Space
content: Shubhanshu Shukla Axiom-4 Mission Launch LIVE Updates: After several delays, SpaceX Falcon 9 spacecraft with the Crew Dragon capsule and four astronauts-- including India's Shubhanshu Shukla-- lifted off on Wednesday.

title: Another Actor, Krishna, Detained By Chennai Police In Cocaine Case
content: In a dramatic escalation of the high-profile cocaine case that has rocked Tamil Nadu's film industry, the Chennai police has detained actor Krishna for questioning.

title: "He Couldn't Have Been Nicer": Trump On Zelensky Meeting
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday his closely watched meeting in The Hague with Ukraine's leader Volodymyr Zelensky "couldn't have been nicer".

title: "Much-Needed Step": Education Minister On CBSE's New Class 10 Exam Format
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday lauded CBSE's decision to conduct class 10 exams twice a year as a "much-needed step" and said it would reduce stress, provide more flexibility and foster a joyful learning environment.

title: NATO Chief Calls Trump "Daddy" For Using F-Word In A Bizarre Compliment
content: Trump dropped the 'f-word' live on TV when he expressed frustration when Iran and Israel violated the ceasefire. "Israel and Iran have been fighting so long and so hard that they don't know what the f**k they're doing", the US President had said.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Dragged Away From Farm, Mauled To Death By Lion In Gujarat
content: A five-year-old son of a labourer was dragged away and mauled to death by a lion in Amreli district on Wednesday afternoon, a forest department official said.

title: At 58, Bihar Minister Selected For Assistant Professor Post. What He Said...
content: For Bihar minister Ashok Choudhary, age is not the limit. At 58, he is set to become an assistant professor. But will he take it, or continue with his political journey?"

title: "Day Wasted": Bombay High Court Dismisses Plea Challenging Maharashtra Election Results
content: A division bench of the Bombay High Court on Wednesday dismissed a petition seeking to nullify the November 2024 Maharashtra Assembly election results.

title: "Our Lips Were Sealed But...": Ex Tihar Official Recalls 1975 Emergency Days
content: "Our lips were sealed but our conscience wasn't," said a retired Tihar Jail official, claiming that during the 1975 Emergency, probe agencies covertly deployed officers inside the prison to monitor staff and political detainees.

title: Teen Girl Murders Mother With Help Of Her Boyfriend In Hyderabad, Arrested: Cops
content: Police have arrested a class 10 student who murdered her mother with the help of her boyfriend and his minor brother.

title: First overall, first in fashion: No. 1 pick looks through the years
content: From Paolo Banchero's purple suit and "P5" chain to LeBron James' all-white look, fashion statements for NBA top draft picks have evolved greatly over the years.

title: What to know ahead of the Austrian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads into round 11 in Spielberg as McLaren's Oscar Piastri remains championship leader - will the Austrian Grand Prix provide any upsets?

title: For USWNT prospects, it's now or never to impress Emma Hayes
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes plans to decide her core group of players soon, which means it's the last chance for many U.S. prospects.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Everton battle for Ndidi
content: Leicester midfielder Wilfred Ndidi is the subject of interest from Manchester United and Everton. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: How women's college stars are powering USA Basketball's AmeriCup team
content: LSU's Flau'jae Johnson and TCU's Olivia Miles are among 12 college standouts competing for the U.S. AmeriCup team.

title: USCIS issues new guidelines on disclosure of ‘derogatory information’
content: the Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries . she also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities .

title: Congress reiterates demand for Maharashtra voter rolls in digital format, says party panel will meet ECI only after that
content: The Opposition party was responding to the invitation for an interaction sent by the poll body to Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi following his allegations of ‘industrial scale’ rigging in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly polls

title: Daughters of residential school staff now eligible for on-campus education
content: The policy decision will reduce the burden on teachers and staff, enabling them to keep their families together while ensuring their daughters receive quality education in a supportive environment

title: New ECINET platform used during bypolls helped with faster update of voter turnout trends: ECI
content: Another major achievement during the bypolls was uploading of voter turnout trends directly by the presiding officers on ECINET as against the earlier manual process

title: Andhra Pradesh Handlooms Weavers Cooperative Society to implement 2022 PRC recommendations for its employees
content: The APCO board approves a proposal allowing the employees to monetise 15 days of earned leave annually

title: Media bodies urge Centre to keep journalistic work outside the ambit of the DPDP Act
content: Twenty-two press bodies located in various States expressed deep concern at the Ministry bringing journalistic work under its ambit, even though it was kept out at the drafting stage of the Bill

title: NHRC issues notice to Odisha government over social boycott of tribal woman
content: Commission seeks report within two weeks after family forced to undergo ‘purification’ ritual following inter-caste marriage in Rayagada district

title: Lucknow cheers city boy; proud moment for all, say parents
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla’s school hosts an event to watch the lift off live; people across Lucknow also celebrate the local boy’s space journey, with people dancing and distributing sweets

title: Karnataka govt. seeks revised proposal for Goa-Tamnar power project
content: This sudden change in stance by the State government on an environmental issue with serious consequences for the sensitive Western Ghats ecosystem has riled up activists

title: After six-year wait, 36 Indian pilgrims arrive at Mount Kailash and Mansarovar for yatra
content: First people-to-people mechanism restored between India and China after COVID and LAC stand-off disrupted the yatra; “the grand organisation for this cross-Himalayan cultural exchange is an important consensus between the leaders of India and China,” says Wen Tao, Deputy Commissioner of Ali Prefecture

title: BMS not to oppose or support general strike on July 9
content: RSS chief to inaugurate concluding ceremony in Delhi; union to focus on gig and platform workers, demands social security for unorganised sector

title: Siddaramaiah meets party top brass, awaits Rahul’s nod for Cabinet reshuffle, filling four seats in Council
content: The party said the Chief Minister has made efforts to convince the high command of the necessity of the Cabinet reshuffle to induct new faces

title: NHRC seeks report from U.P. over custodial deaths in Varanasi jail
content: Commission issues notices to DGP (Prisons) and Varanasi Police Commissioner after three inmates die within two days; asks for post-mortem and magisterial inquiry reports

title: ‘Bharat Mata’ row erupts at Kerala University, Governor’s presence fuels student clashes
content: The event, organised by the Sree Padmanabha Seva Samiti at the university’s Senate Hall in Palayam to mark the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, wades into controversy over a Bharat Mata portrait, which has emerged the bone of contention between the State government and Raj Bhavan for nearly a month

title: U.K. plans to repair grounded F-35B in Kerala itself
content: Engineers from HMS Prince of Wales aircraft carrier had assessed the aircraft, and it had been decided that the support of a U.K.-based engineering team is needed

title: Chhattisgarh seeks Centre’s help after Forest Department stalls community forest resource management plans
content: State Forest Department stops NGOs from starting work on CFR management plans till a model plan is approved; Tribal Ministry guidelines say gram sabhas have authority to approve plans, then consult Forest Departmenmt

title: Bihar leaders mark Emergency anniversary with call to uphold democratic values
content: CM Nitish Kumar, Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary, and BJP’s Anurag Thakur recall legacy of J.P. movement, allege Congress undermined Constitution during Emergency

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu calls for digital currency push, favours withdrawal of ₹500 currency notes
content: Acknowledging the apprehensions about the previous government’s ‘anti-business climate’, the Chief Minister says that era is over, and that investors can come to the State without hesitation as we are developing State across all sectors with the support of the Center

title: Emergency’s dark days still haunt Attappady’s Manappan
content: Manappan’s arrest was a direct result of his affiliation with Communism, an ideology that put him in the crosshairs of the authorities. He was arrested from his hamlet along with fellow tribal leader Bhinnan. The 80-year-old recounts his 18-day ordeal in Palakkad District Jail

title: Censor Board discontinues full access to cuts on website
content: The Censor Board this month has blocked users from fetching cut lists of upcoming films, closing off a constantly updated avenue to check what is being removed each day from the films it is reviewing

title: ICMR increasing mobile lab capacity to enhance India’s outbreak response capabilities
content: The fully indigenous and sophisticated Mobile BSL-3 ‘laboratory on wheels’, first deployed in response to the Nipah virus outbreak in Kerala in 2023, will strengthen public health delivery, especially in remote and inaccessible areas

title: ED attaches ₹27 crore in WB school recruitment scam; total now over ₹636 crore
content: Fresh protests erupt in Kolkata as non-teaching staff demand transparency; ED links latest assets to tea estates owned by prime accused

title: Women’s loco pilot convention seeks dignified life
content: Charter of demands put forth at women’s convention organised by the All India Loco Running Staff Association at Erode

title: Remember the Emergency to keep dictatorship at bay: Shah
content: “We must keep the memories of the Emergency alive so that it is never repeated,” the Home Minister said, urging the youth to read a new book about the PM’s experiences as a young activist during the Emergency

title: West Bengal colleges embrace promotional videos for Under-Graduate admissions
content: With centralised portal open, Kolkata institutions highlight infrastructure, faculty, and student initiatives through curated visual content

title: CPI(M) opposes second phase of land pooling for Amaravati
content: The government’s decision to acquire an additional 44,000 acres of land is driven by real estate interests rather than genuine developmental needs, alleges party State secretary Srinivasa Rao

title: ‘Black days of Emergency’ recalled at two meetings organised by BJP and CPI(M) in Tirupati
content: The Emergency period plunged the entire nation into darkness, says BJP national spokesperson Aparajitha Sarangi

title: Revision committee of CBFC likely to decide on Janaki vs State of Kerala on June 26
content: Producer firm tells HC that film’s worldwide release is on June 27 and further delay in issuing censor certificate will cause irreparable loss

title: Kerala Automobiles Limited launches electric ice cream carts for Milma
content: Ten electric carts each will be provided to the regional cooperative milk producers’ units in Thiruvananthapuram, Ernakulam and Kozhikode

title: President, PM extend best wishes for Shubhanshu Shukla’s space odyssey
content: The whole nation is excited and proud of an Indian’s journey into the stars, says Murmu; Shukla carries with him the wishes, hopes and aspirations of 1.4 billion Indians, says Modi

title: Jagan launches five-week campaign targeting coalition government’s ‘unfulfilled’ promises in Andhra Pradesh
content: The QR code-based initiative titled, ‘Recalling Chandrababu’s Manifesto’, involves mass outreach across all districts and villages

title: Telangana’s EV, electronics sectors feeling the heat of China’s export curbs: Sridhar Babu
content: Meets Union Minister Piyush Goyal urging Centre to immediately intervene, formulate strategic alternatives to mitigate disruption caused by the restrictions on rare earth elements

title: Ethiraj College offers free admission to transgender student
content: In an apparent first among women’s colleges, a private institution in Chennai has opened its gates for a student of the transgender community.

title: APPGCET results see 88.6% pass rate with girls outperforming boys
content: The tests were held for 31 subjects and the question papers were provided in English as well as Telugu, say officials

title: Fire breaks out in the house of accused in contractor’s murder in Shiggaon
content: As it comes in the wake of the murder, the crime has led to the suspicion that it is an act of vengeance

title: Traffic chaos on NH 544 sparks strong criticism against NHAI
content: Collector, MP, MLA conduct field visit, review meeting highlights serious lapses by the National Highways Authority of India in ensuring smooth alternative traffic through service roads

title: Centre, Telangana join hands for 3,245 acres Zaheerabad Industrial Area project
content: Project a priority under Hyderabad Nagpur Industrial Corridor, special purpose vehicle formed, set to boost manufacturing in the State

title: Rain continues to lash Dharwad district
content: Several towns and villages record incessant rainfall in the last 24 hours but no casualties have been reported

title: Supreme Court questions probe agencies’ direct summons to lawyers
content: Bench says prima facie the practice hurts autonomy of legal profession; refers the issue to Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai for directions

title: MMA World Power Index: Eight countries represented at UFC 317
content: MMA is a true example of an international sport . 10 countries are represented among the 17 divisional champions . 26 fighters from eight nations capping off the UFC's international Fight Week . the voting criteria were based on four factors: current champions, ranked fighters across all divisi .

title: Club World Cup Daily: Liam Delap scores first Chelsea goal, Blues qualify to last 16
content: atletico madrid manager Diego Simeone believes "nobody cares" about their group stage elimination . the 2025 world cup has produced plenty of talking points and storylines already . we will update this file throughout each matchday with the latest news, analysis and fun .

title: Mock draft: Derrick Henry biggest mover in change to non-PPR
content: Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty is ranked ahead of saquon Barkley in fantasy drafts . the gap between the fifth and sixth quarterbacks off the board continues to be sizable . this draft featured the following participants (in order of first-round selection)

title: Final draft rankings: Schaefer, Misa, Hagens, then...?
content: the top 64 are ranked here, along with details of their game, areas for development, perception among NHL scouts and an NHL projection . some players grade at higher or lower value than in previous rankings, but their position considers how likely they are to become NHL players based on their developmental needs and perception .

title: First-team reps? Big plays? A sneak peek at how the 2025 NFL draft first-rounders look
content: rookies across the league have had their chance to make their first impressions . there were 32 first-round picks from the 2025 draft . a group of rookie pass catchers came to the building at 5 a.m. .

title: Which Finals stars made our top five?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder have been crowned NBA champions for the first time since arriving in the Sooner State 17 years ago . the NHL handles its postseason honors that way, with the Conn Smythe Trophy awarded to the player with the best overall postseason . we set out to fill that gap with our five-player MVP ballot .

title: Messi joins legends with stadiums, stands named after them
content: newell's old boys named a stand in honor of their eight-time ballon d'Or winning alumnus . a section of their stadium known as the colossus will be forever emblazoned with tributes to club legends . it was renamed Estadio Marcelo Bielsa in 2009 to herald the achievements of one of the infamously unorthodox coach who masterminded the Primera División title triumph .

title: Fantasy rankings: Caitlin Clark claims top spot
content: the 2025 rookie class takes center stage in this week's fantasy women's basketball rankings update . the rankings also have a new no. 1 player as a'ja Wilson returned from injury with a bang . last week, top player Caitlin Clark has struggled over the past three games .

title: Grading the Celtics' flurry of trades, plus every deal so far
content: the offseason is here, and trades are already being agreed to across the league . the trade window kicked off when the Memphis Grizzlies agreed to trade guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony . on Sunday, the most highly anticipated offseason trade took place as Phoenix Suns forward and former MVP Kevin Durant was traded to the Houston Rockets .

title: Madden NFL 26 reveals first look at game play with new trailer
content: EA Sports has promised a long list of improvements and feature additions for Madden NFL 26 . signature identity includes three key pillars -- signature identity, community requests and foundational football . the game's core mechanics require a bit more elaboration .

title: MCWS 2025: What it means for LSU, favorite moments, 2026 predictions
content: the 2025 MCWS broke away from last year's SEC/ACC takeover . the tournament was the 75th anniversary of the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska . analysts share their favorite moments from the tournament and offer predictions for 2026 .

title: Divisional: Sizable movement at heavyweight, light heavyweight
content: aspinall already was no. 1 in the ESPN heavyweight rankings . the only change in the latest divisional rankings is one weight class down at light heavyweight . hill falls to no. 8 on the strength of his dominating win over former champion jamahal Hill .

title: Ranking the top 50 MLB trade deadline candidates
content: Xavier Scruggs names the players he believes could be up for grabs at the trade deadline . some of the players on the list are unlikely to be dealt but at least are being discussed in potential deals . players are ranked by value for their new team, not likelihood of being dealt .

title: New Boston NWSL coach promises 'passion,' press
content: Filipa Pato is the first head coach of the 2026 NWSL expansion team . the 36-year-old spent the past five years coaching portugal side benfica . she says her teams play with passion .

title: 🥊Inside a wild weekend with Canelo and Crawford
content: canelo alvarez and Terence Crawford face in a mega-fight on sept. 13 in Las Vegas . he's on the second leg of a three-leg tour to promote his upcoming fight . the pair are both confident about their upcoming clash .
